Author: steamon
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: I wish Opakeco and their team good luck with their ICO. The crypto world do really need some charity solutions to make the world a better place. I will also keep fighting for charities in crypto. We are just at the starting line with all those new solutions showing up using blockchain. Be smart and invest into charity solutions like Opakeco it will make the world a better place and help the poor in the other countries. They could really have a helping hand those days because countries are sending less and fewer funds to 3rd world countries. Crypto solutions can bring back the help.

Author: ren-e
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: For the ones that have been following our efforts, they'll know that we've been working hard at this project for about 2 months now, and it has been an absolute rollercoaster.  If you've ever spoken more in depth with anyone from Opakeco, you know that the Opakeco fundamentals have been brewing inside our minds for several years now.  We've put large amounts of work into getting every done in the last week months: - getting the whitepaper to its final state; - speaking with many charities to run pilot projects with; - reaching out to interesting organizations for partnerships; and - getting invited to present ourselves at the WebSummit in Lisbon.  All these things are good to go, but we do feel that we're not ready yet, and we have huge opportunities in the pipeline that haven't been properly finalized yet. We need some extra time to make everything _perfect_.  For now, we can say the ICO will start somewhere in September, but we need to plan some things out and reschedule. We will come back on this tomorrow.

Author: steamon
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: My conclusion is that the crypto world is not ready for a charity coin yet. They have managed to get around the same as TribeToken. They tried their best in promoting. The point, not the promoting thing. People want fast returns. Charity in blockchain is the future. But basically its better to get a private investment out of this and release an ICO then when the platform has a proper working demo. That would be my recommendation. I am further not working on TribeToken anymore. It was everything or nothing and did not reach enough to even open an office to let everyone work on the project. I did learn a lot from that experience and I hope Opakeco does not give up and maybe can go the private investor way. Blockchain will only get hotter in 2018. Why did I not say this earlier? I didn't want to demotivate the Opakeco team.

Author: ren-e
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: We are moving to ERC-223 due to the improvements made. The new standard makes it possible to do a single transaction for token deposits and reduce our gas consumption. If you're interested in all the advantages or changes you can check the github: https://github.com/Dexaran/ERC23-tokens/

I don't wanna be too negative but our ICO did not really collect a lot of ETH in the terms of doing something for charity.  Also, I can't find a working demo yet of your platform/product?  I am open for talking if you open up a slack.  EDIT:  Best of luck with your ICO.

Author: Aki4real
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Hi! Thanks for reaching out to us! Helping the world to become a better place is a central theme in both projects, I hope yours will be succesful as well. Maybe at the end there will be a huge influx of last-minute investors.  We truly believe there is a place within the crypto-ecosystem for a charity/humanitarian based platform.  Our marketing is being expanded as we speak, we've been featured on www.the-blockchain.com and are working together with icocountdown.com. Also there are several partnership negotiations going on.  Our ICO date is ambitious and we will re-evaluate if we don't generate enough publicity. Our slack will open later today and our Github has been updated with the latest contracts, take a look at github.com/opakeco.  We always welcome feedback, after all.. we want to make the world a better place!

Author: ojackie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Great point! And not just investors want to have the funds kept securely, we do as well! After we finish up on the contracts (and deploy them on the network), anyone will be able to verify what I am about to say. Or, if we did it wrong, debunk it, in which case we would require a redo of the affected contract(s).  The smart contracts for asset management work by storing Ether (these are the funds sent in to exchange for Karmo tokens) sent from the ICO contract. The ICO contract transfers this to a contract wallet that is called every quarter to release a set amount of funds to the Opakeco Ether wallet address. Only when Ether arrives in this wallet, will it be usable by the Opakeco foundation. Alongside this, there is a mechanism that does a refund of all remaining Ether to the contributors in the case there is a vote to stop Opakeco using a kill switch contract.  With regards to the security of the specific wallet address, I refer you to my colleague, René (ren-e), as I know how much he enjoys explaining the layers of physical and information security surrounding the usage of our funds.

Author: ren-e
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: It's quite extensive, but to summarise what we’ve done for the wallet security is creating a dedicated computer for the wallet. This computer is installed using an automated process, which has been documented and reviewed. The installation will verify all required files, so we are certain the installation is clean. This computer has been secured with a firewall, full disk encryption, multi factor authentication and the BIOS has been locked down. But don’t get me wrong there is absolutely nothing on this computer that gives you access to the wallets. All secrets have been generated in memory, so they were never stored on this computer. The wallets have been stored on three USB devices, which also contain multiple layers of security. The USB devices, computer and secrets are all stored separately in a vault.  We’re not stopping there, because the process also needed attention. At least two members from Opakeco are required in operating the wallets. Before we can use the wallet we must verify whether the computer, Ethereum client or USB devices needs to be updated. All the required commands for the transaction are prepared and reviewed before execution. The synchronisation with the blockchain and the transaction itself is done separately. When the transaction has been made the secrets, USB device and computer device will be locked away in the vault.  Hope this gives you an idea how it's setup.

Author: gomei
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: hello, ojackie and ren-e, thank you for answering my quesiton. That is very cool, I think you have tried your best to keep the funds safe and it is enough in my opinion.

Author: Aki4real
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Slack | Whitepaper | Website | Github| Blog | Twitter | Reddit   The Opakeco Foundation has a vision: A world where humanitarian causes are fully transparent and held accountable..  It has always been theoretically possible to have full oversight of good causes. In practice, the Opakeco Foundation have learned that this is never the case. Over time, however, the feasibility of making this vision into reality has grown by leaps and bounds. With the coming of blockchain technology, digital transparency could be reached. And now with Ethereum smart contracts and the possibility to issue tokens, the Opakeco Foundation finally has a way to make our vision a reality.       Summary  The Opakeco Foundation is building a platform where token holders will be able to exert control over the foundation and support charities without the need of technical skills. In time, opakeco will become the quality label for measuring the transparency of charities and well-doers.  The Opakeco platform thrives on a connected community: as a token holder, your vote counts. Together, we decide what decisions to take; together, we steer the foundation; and together, we will help humanity.  The Opakeco Foundation wants to emphasize that token holders decide. Decisions within opakeco are made by asking everyone, with the majority of the deciding power in the hands of the community. Important points here are that token holders will be able to vote on all strategic decisions, including, but not limited to quarterly budgets, strategic goals and even board members.  Within the same platform users will be able to communicate with different charities,  verified well-doers and people who aim to make a change in their community. The platform will let you see to what extent a certain well-doer or charity is transparent according to the metrics the Opakeco Foundation uses.  Our goal is to have charities use our tokens to buy food, medical supplies and other necessities -- this can range from building water wells and houses to providing solar-powered lights -- that can help their cause.  Token holders will be able to send tokens to well-doers and charities through the Opakeco platform. So apart from the efforts that the foundation itself will be putting into aiding different causes all around the world, token holders are able to have a direct impact in a cause they feel strongly about.  The Opakeco Foundation will help organizations to become more transparent and give them an Opakeco rating according to the measures they have taken to be transparent.  This organization will be fully transparent and lead by example. The Opakeco Foundation will publish all internal company communication after 24 hours and token holders are able to see our income and expenses.  Key Features  New standard in communication with humanitarian causes Vote with tokens to decide on tactical and strategic decisions Send aid to humanitarian causes using tokens Built-in killswitch contract, refunds ETH if voting threshold is met Founder tokens locked for 5 years Token Buy back program with 40% of positive equity in Q4 Quality mark for humanitarian causes   Roadmap     Contribution Period  Start Time: 21-09-2017 Duration: One week Target: 10.000 ETH Hard Cap: 100.000 ETH   Token distribution  The Opakeco Foundation wants to a fair and wide distribution of tokens, the following steps have been taken to achieve this:  Fixed gas price (transactions above or below this gas price will be rejected) No whitelisted addresses No 3rd-party allocations No bonus structure    * Founder tokens will be locked in publicly disclosed wallets, They will be released gradually, at a rate of 5% per 3 months. Effectively meaning founder tokens will be fully released after 5 years.    Team   Chief Technology Officer Jackie Xu https://www.linkedin.com/in/mrxuj/ computer scientist and entrepreneur with a love for new technology and charity   Chief Executive Officer Akash Parmesar https://www.linkedin.com/in/akashparmesar/ visionary entrepreneur with a passion for cryptocurrency and humanitarian causes   Chief Information Officer Rene Ammerlaan https://www.linkedin.com/in/rene-ammerlaan/ communications expert with a passion for cryptocurrency and cybersecurity   Chief Marketing Officer Akis Karamanlis https://www.linkedin.com/in/akiskaramanlis/ creative innovator with a passion for charities   Chief Creative Officer Iskander Mos https://www.linkedin.com/in/iskander-mos-35b92257/ gifted storyteller with a passion for new technologies   Advisors  Bart den Hertog Marketing and Business Development https://www.linkedin.com/in/bartdhertog/  Koen Basten Software Engineering https://github.com/kbasten/  Niko van Meurs UX, Design and Software Engineering https://www.linkedin.com/in/nikovanmeurs/  Finn Boonman Marketing https://www.linkedin.com/in/finnboonman/   The Catch  Honestly, there is no “catch”.   The team behind Opakeco will do its hardest to set a leading example for the community. We care about the project and we want it to succeed, to emphasize this our CTO and CIO will work the first quarter without a salary!  We want to prove to you that our interests are aligned with our mission. The total amount of ETH is released gradually with the approval of token holders. We are all willing to put our reputation on the line for this project, as the Opakeco Foundation will be as transparent as any organization can be.  The Opakeco Foundation will add constant value to the tokens with our buy back program and adding features/functionalities, but we’d rather see a gradual incline of the value than a “moon” type of launch.   We will pour our heart and soul in this project, what about you? Can the Opakeco Foundation count you in?   Disclaimer: This ANN is not for US residents and those of Hong Kong, You can’t participate in the ICO if you are either a Hong Kong or U.S. citizen or permanent resident of the United States, or have a primary residence or domicile in the United States, including Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and any other territories of the United States.   Only the following accounts will make official statements about The Opakeco Foundation  Opakeco: Opakeco Akash: Aki4real Jackie: ojackie Rene: ren-e Akis: AkissikA Iskander: Jestersdream   Bounties:  Bug Bounty Up to 1.000.000 Karmo (roughly 33 ETH worth) for a severe bug Up to 300.000 Karmo (roughly 10 ETH worth) for an interesting bug 30.000 Karmo (roughly 1 ETH worth) for a small bug  Contracts: Github  Translation Bounty 13.000 Karmo (roughly 0.5 ETH worth) for a translation  Spanish translation done by freemind1: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2050351.0 German translation done by haxxlega: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2067413.0 Hindi translation done by erikalui: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2069586.new#new Italian translation done by cryptotum88: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2069688.0 Russian translation done by awallon: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2069785.0 Korean translation done by solidliquid: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2085604.0 Vietnamese translation done by boyprodn: https://bitcoingarden.org/forum/index.php?topic=17612 French translation done by elkmar: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2073572.new#new Indonesian translation done by erickvand: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2120082.0

Author: ojackie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Dropping in to say hi as long-time passive lurker, forced into the open.  As a small non-technical addendum to the opening post: the Opakeco foundation is a registered non-profit in the Netherlands. We are required by law to submit all our finances, including any sort of value we possess, be it crypto or otherwise. At the moment, we are hard at work to get all the technical bits up-and-running, verified and validated, so do stay tuned. In the mean time, any question is welcome.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes

Author: Aki4real
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Hi! Thanks for your interest in our foundation. The website will be up and running later today.  To answer your question, we will leave it up to our token holders to decide which strategic goals to pursue. We have our own relations within the charity sector, but they are diverse.. from Kenya to India. So we don't have a specific country or project we focus on, we want to change the sector as a whole.  If you have any other questions let me know, I'll be happy to answer them.  *edit: Also we don't only focus on charity, we are aiming at all humanitarian causes.

But you will get 26.000 Karmo tokens for 1 ETH.  If you have any more questions, I'd be happy to hear from you.

Author: ojackie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Site's just a placeholder for now -- the more expansive version should be up within a day at most.  Your question regarding which country/countries the charity itself is focused on is both easy and hard to answer: none. These decisions reside on a strategic level, and these decisions are made by including everyone within the foundation and the community surrounding it.  I know quite a few Dutch humanitarian charities -- PAZHolandesa, for example, is a charity that focuses on Peruvian children with cleft lip/palate. A subject that hits close to home for me, because I grew up with family members with cleft lip, and know the struggle that surrounds it -- that are dear to me. Therefore I would want to put them up for consideration. Someone else in the community might know a different charity that is quite dear to them, and one that gathers more support and sympathy from everyone within Opakeco. In this case we would decide to help the latter.  So to clarify, the only real focus Opakeco has, is to better the people around us that don't have it as well as a large part of the world. That is a large segment, yes. For this we have everyone gathering together to decide and help.

Author: Grant Hero
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Out of curiosity, what is this restricted from US residents?  Is this because you are concerned about your token being classified as a security by the SEC?

Author: ojackie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Interesting question! This is correct, even though the Opakeco foundation has no legal way to have securities. In the Netherlands, a non-profit foundation has no form of securities; it is only run by board members and a chairman. However, the Opakeco Foundation has a somewhat interesting extra, that has no officially legal foothold: the tokens issued by the foundation can be used to vote for decisions that have legal repercussions. Effectively, this means that -- as long as the board of Opakeco performs its duties according to the democratic votes -- a token is akin to a share.  In the eyes of the SEC, the foundation is then a legal entity that is in a way selling securities without being registered with the SEC.  The ways to circumvent this would be to either qualify for the exemptions listed under rules 504, 505 or 506 of Regulation D and apply with the SEC; or perform a check to see whether anyone that is a US resident meets any of the SEC requirements of an accredited investor.  Unfortunately the foundation qualifies for none of the exemptions mentioned above, nor is it feasible (from both legal and decentralized standpoints) to perform the check. Hopefully this clarifies our standpoint.

Author: malspils
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Hi,  When a Tsunami/earthquake strikes, will it be possible to create a fund (or whatever you call it) so these people get our help ASAP?

Author: Aki4real
Title: [ANN][ICO] Opakeco: Transparency and Accountability for Humanitarian Causes
Body: Hello!  Interesting question! There are several options to help people in immediate distress situations like you're describing.  1. With our platform you will be able to send aid with karmo tokens, through the humanitarian causes that are working with the Opakeco Foundation. You will have full insight in what resources will be aqcuired with your tokens.  2. As a token holder, you can initiate a proposal which can be voted upon. (Example: Would like the foundation to focus resources on Tsunami at country X)  3. You will be able to set up a project/crowdfund Karmo tokens with other token holders.  The Foundation will focus on making sure everything is transparent and accountable, however we do not choose for what humanitarian cause the resources are spent. You as a token holder will decide that.
